name: Spambot Minion
Name: Jamming
Description: Minions will attempt to jam TITAN communications and radar using universal jamming (p. 262, EP).

name: Spambot Minion
Name: Spam Mist
Description: Everyone within mesh range of the spambot suffers a −30 Perception Test modifier due to AR spam overload. This may be cleared with an Interfacing Test at −30, but will return after 10 minutes as the spam compensates for the filtering; see Traffic Filters and Mist, p. 248, EP. Alternatively, AR may be turned off, but this will disable tacnets and hinder other gear.

name: TITAN Smart Mine
Name: Volatile
Description: Smart mines that suffer a wound have a 5% chance of exploding: DV 6d10 + 12, AP −4, blast area effect.

name: TITAN Smart Mine
Name: Suicide Strike
Description: Inflicts exactly enough DV to cause 2 wounds (including armor). There is a 25% chance this cripples or amputates a limb; victims losing legs move at a quarter their normal movement rate until healed or repaired (pp. 208 and 327, EP).

name: Transhuman Smart Mine
Name: Volatile
Description: Smart mines that suffer a wound have a 20% chance of exploding: DV 1d10 + 2, AP −4, blast area effect.

name: Immolator Drone
Name: Exsurgent Infection
Description: Drones can infect biomorphs with the glory exsurgent virus (p. 175) by exchanging bodily fluids.

name: Zombie Crab
Name: Protist Infection
Description: After 5 days, the victim’s temperature spikes and they lose 5 points from all aptitudes each day, down to a minimum of 5. Victims receive the Modified Behavior (Enforced: Seek Out Water) trait.

name: Wild Artificial Loper
Name: Caltrop Variant
Description: Deploys caltrops over a 5-meter radius. Characters or wheeled vehicles/bots that move through the area without spotting the caltrops (Perception Test at −30) suffer DV 1d10 + 3 (armor does not protect); vehicles must must a Pilot Test or crash.

name: Wild Artificial Loper
Name: Smuggler Variant
Description: Chameleon Skin, Hidden Compartment, Thermal Dampening

name: Wild Artificial Loper
Name: Caltrop Variant
Description: Hidden Compartment, DV 6d10 + 20, AP −4, blast area effect

name: Whipper
Name: Undersea Variant
Description: Add Swimming 40, Echolocation, Eelware, Gills, Hydrostatic Pressure Adaptation, Temperature Tolerance (Cryonic)

name: Whipper
Name: Armored Variant
Description: Add Carapace Armor (12/10), Medichines, Oxygen Reserve, Radiation Tolerance, Temperature Tolerance, Vacuum Sealing

name: Whiplash
Name: Larger Variant
Description: As above, but with SOM 25, Unarmed Combat 50 (Subdual 60), Large Size trait (+10 to hit), DUR 45, WT 9, DR 68

name: Vydra
Name: Frenzy
Description: If a vydra smells or tastes blood, it will enter into a murderous frenzy. Increase REF and Fray by +10, and the vydra can ignore the effects of 2 wounds. This effect lasts until the vydra has no more prey to kill in the immediate vicinity and it has gorged on its victim(s).

name: Void Crawler
Name: Gravity Sensitivity
Description: In gravity higher than 0.1 g, treat void crawlers as suffering from the effects of 1 wound. In gravity higher than 0.3 g, treat this as 2 wounds and reduce their Movement Rate by half. At 0.5 g and higher, they suffer DV 2 per minute and are effectively incapacitated.

name: Void Crawler
Name: Light Sensitivity
Description: Void crawlers are adapted to dim light. Extremely bright lights blind them, inflicting a −10 modifier or more.

name: Void Crawler
Name: Mindlink
Description: Void crawlers remain mindlinked when within 15 meters of one other (and to others through each other).

name: Veiled Leech
Name: Pounce
Description: Veiled leeches often attack with surprise (no defense). On its next action, the leech will bite with mouth suckers, inflicting DV 1d10 ÷ 2 (no defense, round down) and injecting sucker toxin (see below). Leeches will continue to suck blood and fluids for 1d10 + 4 Action Turns, inflicting DV 3 (no defense) each turn.

name: Veiled Leech
Name: Sucker Toxin
Description: Injected, Onset: Immediate, Duration: 1 hour (30 minutes with medichines). Victims must make a SOM x 3 Test or fall unconscious. Those awake still suffer steep docility and lethargy; they must pass a WIL x 2 Test to take any action, and all actions suffer a −30 modifier.

name: Think Tank
Name: Deflectors
Description: Think tanks are equipped with supercapacitors embedded within their armor that release a massive charge at the area pinpointed by an attack, creating a temporary, huge, electromagnetic force field that repels or destroys incoming projectiles. This provides a −30 modifier to hit the tank, but only against kinetic weapon and seeker attacks that the think tank has detected. These deflectors have 20 uses before they must be recharged, which takes 2 hours.

name: Stinger Hound
Name: Camouflage
Description: Stinger hounds that remain still and crouched under their shell receive a +30 to Infiltration Tests to hide.

name: Stalker
Name: Infrasonic Emitter
Description: All biomorphs within 30 meters must make a SOM Test or be nauseated and disoriented, suffering −30 to all actions for 1 minute. This test must be taken again if exposed for more than a minute. Additionally, for each full minute a biomorph is exposed (nauseated or not), they suffer DV 1d10 + 2, no defense. This effect works through walls, ground, and water, but not vacuum.

name: Snapper
Name: Armored Variant
Description: Heavy Armor (+16/+16), Offensive Armor Mod (shock effect; p. 204, EP), Self-Healing Armor Mod, 2 Weapon Mounts (External, Articulated) with twin Railgun Machine Guns (DV 2d10 + 8, AP −9, BF/FA, Ammo 500)

name: Slouch
Name: Self-Destruct
Description: Slouches carry a small plasma magnetic bottle that will detonate when they take more than 75 points of damage or if anyone attempts to open up or otherwise tamper with a disabled slouch. This explosion inflicts DV 5d10 + 16, AP −6, blast area effect, and will completely destroy the slouch.

name: Slouch
Name: Bessel Beam Turret
Description: This device functions like a tractor/repulsor beam. Struck targets are pushed either directly towards or away from the slouch. The distance moved depends on the target’s size: very small, 20 meters; small: 10 meters; medium: 5 meters; large: 1 meter, very large: unaffected. Struck targets are trapped by the beam and must make a SOM Test to escape its grasp or they will continue to be attracted/repelled each Action Turn. Max Range 500. These turrets have 20 turns of use and take 4 hours to recharge.

name: Skrik
Name: Bioware
Description: Skriks will have the same bioware as their exsurgent parent, but not cyberware or nanoware. Some skriks will have mutations such as Claws, Extra Limbs, Poison Gland, etc.

name: Skrik
Name: Swarm Tactics
Description: A large number of skriks (50+) will attack as a swarm. Use the rules for (Swarms, p. 168), with a Durability of 80.

name: Skitter
Name: Microswarm
Description: Skitters follow the rules for (Swarms, p. 168). Stats given are for a standard swarm unit, not individual microbots.

name: Skitter
Name: Jam Radio
Description: Radios and radar suffers interference, imposing a –30 modifier on all sensor-related tests. Targets may attempt to overcome this interference by beating the skitter in an Opposed Interface Test.

name: Skitter
Name: Blinding Lasers
Description:
Skitter swarms may deploy lasers to blind cameras much like a dazzler (p. 316, EP). 
These lasers will blind characters as well for 1 minute unless they make a REF x 3 Test. Anti-glare cyberware protects against blinding.

name: Skitter
Name: Sabotage
Description: DV 1d10 each Action Turn (no defense, armor applies but is reduced) to all synthmorphs and non-biological devices touched by and targeted by the swarm.

name: Shifter
Name: Mimicry
Description: Succeeds with an Opposed Impersonation vs. Kinesics Test. The synthetic nature of mimicked biomorphs is obvious with t-rays or physical contact, or an enhanced vision/radar Perception Test at −30.

name: Shifter
Name: Mimicry
Description: Shifters change form in half the timeframe of transhuman tech and can create complex, mechanical forms such as firearms or implants.

name: Puppet Elite Agent
Name: Basilisk Hack
Description: Deployed via augmented reality. See Basilisk Hacks, p. 365, EP.

name: Ny’knikiin
Name: Ny’knikiin software
Description: Ny’knikiin software is radically different from transhuman designs. Attempts to use or subvert ny’knikiin gear require extensive study (timeframe: 1 week)and suffer a −30 modifier. Ny’knikiin hackers are common and have software comparable to transhuman equivalents, but are at a similar disadvantage working with transhuman systems.

name: Mantis Worm
Name: Acid Plume
Description: Threatened swarms release a plume of acid in the water, extending 5 meters around the swarm. Anyone caught in this plume suffers DV 1d10 ÷ 2 each turn and must make a SOM x 2 Test or flee (negated by Pain Tolerance).

name: Guardian Brute
Name: Intimidating
Description: Brutes receive a +20 modifier on Intimidation Tests.

name: Guardian Brute
Name: Decoy Weapons
Description: Brutes are sometimes equipped or implanted with obvious but fake heavy weapons systems, such as seekers or plasma rifles. These may be spotted as fake with a Perception Test at −30.

name: Guardian Brute
Name: Bullet Magnet
Description: Brutes are modified to soak as much damage as possible. They may ignore the effects of 2 wounds.

name: Guardian Spider Head
Name: Volatile
Description: Any damaging hit on a spider bot has a (20 + DV inflicted)% chance of setting off the explosives it carries.

name: Leftover Special Snack Bar
Name: Flesh Regeneration
Description: Snack bars regenerate 1d10 damage or 1 wound per hour; all damage must be healed before wounds.
